meanings.definition: To be more than the equal of; outweigh.
meanings.sent1: The delicious cake overbalances the plain salad in taste.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness overbalances any flaws she may have.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's excitement overbalances its tiny body, making it tumble over.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for the project overbalances his lack of experience.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the books overbalances the strength of the shelf, causing it to collapse.

meanings.definition: To cause to lose balance or stability.
meanings.sent1: The sudden gust of wind overbalances the fragile vase on the table.
meanings.sent2: The slippery floor can easily overbalance an unsteady person.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once can overbalance even the most organized person.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news overbalances her emotions, causing her to stumble.
meanings.sent5: The heavy backpack overbalances the hiker, making him fall backwards.
